A4.text: Michael Crawford is best known for playing the titular character in the stage musical The Phantom of the Opera.

A5.text: Crawford's acclaimed performance in The Phantom of the Opera earned him the Laurence Olivier Award and Tony Award for Best Actor in a Leading Role in a Musical.

A6.text: Mark Jacoby portrayed The Phantom in The Phantom of the Opera from 1991 to 1993.

A7.text: Mark Jacoby is listed in the official The Phantom of the Opera site's list of past Phantoms.

A8.text: Steven Neal Barton originated the role of Raoul, Vicomte de Chagny in the West End and Broadway productions of Andrew Lloyd Webberâ€™s The Phantom of the Opera.

A9.text: In 1989, Barton reprised his performance as Raoul opposite Crawford's Phantom in the Ahmanson Theatre production when the principal Raoul actor was injured.
